content.title: Annal Ambedkar Business Champions Scheme
content.department: Department of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
content.beneficiary: Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe entrepreneurs
content.details: The scheme 'Annal Ambedkar Business Champions Scheme (AABCS)' was launched by the Department of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, Government of Tamil Nadu. The Government of Tamil Nadu noted that the share of persons from Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe communities who avail of various entrepreneurship promotion subsidies from the Government is very low. In order to promote the economic development of SC/ST entrepreneurs, this scheme has been launched by the Government of Tamil Nadu. The new scheme will provide a 35% capital subsidy and offer a 6% interest subvention for loans to procure machinery and equipment.
benefits: 35% capital subsidy on the Eligible Project Cost, not exceeding ₹1.5 Crore.
6% interest subvention for loans sanctioned under this scheme.
eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of the State of Tamil Nadu.
The beneficiaries shall be persons belonging to SC/ST communities. Enterprises supported under the scheme shall be 100% owned by persons belonging to SC/STs.
The scheme can support both new enterprises and expansion of existing enterprises.
The eligible enterprises can be business enterprises in the areas of manufacturing and services.
The age limit for beneficiaries will be 55 years.
There shall be no minimum educational qualification for beneficiaries.
There will be no bar on the beneficiary to claim additional capital subsidy from schemes operated by agencies not controlled by the Government of Tamil Nadu.
content.application_process: Online application through the Official Website of the Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises Department, Government of Tamil Nadu.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. copy of Election ID Card/ Aadhaar card

faqs.question: Who are the beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: The beneficiaries shall be persons belonging to SC/ST communities. Enterprises supported under the scheme shall be 100% owned by persons belonging to SC/STs.

faqs.question: What is the age limit to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The age limit for beneficiaries will be 55 years.

faqs.question: Anyone residing outside Tamil Nadu State can start business in Tamil Nadu under the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the applicant should be a resident of Tamil Nadu State.

faqs.question: Is there any income ceiling to get assistance under the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no family income ceiling prescribed for assistance in setting up projects under this scheme.

faqs.question: What does project cost include?
faqs.answer: The project costs include land, plant, machinery, testing equipment, and computing devices with the cost of land not exceeding 20% of the project cost.

faqs.question: How much maximum subsidy is available under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, the State Government will provide a 35% capital subsidy on the Eligible Project Cost, not exceeding ₹1.5 Crore.

faqs.question: What should be the minimum qualification required to avail of the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: There shall be no minimum educational qualification for beneficiaries.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for the new enterprises?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme can support both new enterprises and the expansion of existing enterprises.

faqs.question: What type of businesses are covered under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The eligible enterprises can be business enterprises in the areas of manufacturing and services.

faqs.question: Will the Entrepreneurship Development Training be given to all beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: Yes, Entrepreneurship Development Training will be given to all beneficiaries by Entrepreneurship Development and Innovation Institute.

faqs.question: At what rate will interest subvention be given for loans sanctioned under this scheme?
faqs.answer: A 6% interest subvention will be given for loans sanctioned under this scheme.

faqs.question: For how many years interest subvention shall be sanctioned for working capital of the project?
faqs.answer: The working capital sanctioned for the project shall be eligible for interest subvention for a period not exceeding 2 years.
